text: when a knife fish swims waves move along
its fin to propel it forward or backward
same with the cuttlefish and the small
Persian carpet flatworm for all of them
the length of the wave is about 20 times
the side-to-side movement of the finland
and the amplitude these creatures are
from widely different branches of the
Tree of Life
why do they all swim the same way
because it works that 20 to 1 ratio is
ideal
scientists at Northwestern University
figured that out when they used a
computer simulation and a robot to study
this kind of swimming data for 22 kinds
of swimming creatures showed that
evolution agreed the same swimming
pattern and ratio appeared at least 8
different times in the history of life
that's convergent evolution no big
surprise there
birds bats and insects all have wings
but a precise measurement of convergence
that's something new eight times
evolution faced the same physics problem
eight times it got the right answer
